p: These actions follow in practice what is recommended in the Roadmap for ESD (UNESCO, 2020); however, they are hardly recognised in local or national policy reports, or in media. It seems that children, teachers, local, national, and international politicians and businessmen don’t speak the same language. The differences point at a language divide between different stakeholders, levels and groups of people. Ärlemalm-Hagsér and Elliott (2020) argues that there is also a rhetoric-reality and a knowledge-practice gap between the expressions in international policy compared to the level of action taken with critical implications for both early childhood educators and for children’s lives.
